chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Rice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 2:47pm 
Defendant Justin J. Rice in court, in custody, with Attorney Amber Rumpf. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #3 and #4. 

On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Rice to:
--serve six months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges forthwith
--34 days credit for time already served given

The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Rice on Probation for one year with conditions: 
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as directed by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as directed by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs and surcharges 

The Courts the forfeiture and destruction of the subject firearm. The State is to submit a proposed order 
recess 3:03pm
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, Elements and CCS
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 2:11pm 
Defendant Justin J. Rice in court, in custody, with Attorney Amber Rumpf.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Rice waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
Attorney Rumpf requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing; the Defense has received a plea offer. 
recess 2:18pm 

NEXT: Plea and Sentencing on July 28th at 2:30pm
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
[ml] Case called at 1:52PM
Defendant Justin J. Rice appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Att Rumpf provides an updated address for the Defendant: 309 Rockwell Ave, #8 Fort Atkinson, WI 53538.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit at the request of the Defense.

The Court requires a $500.00 Cash Bond with no special conditions.

recess 2:00PM

NEXT: Prelimianry Hearing on 07/15 at 2:00PM with in person appearances in Branch I
